events.name: Salesforce Singapore Advantage Tour 2016
events.description: Salesforce Singapore Advantage Tour 2016!! Salesforce team planning to involve our developer community members from Singapore in the Advantage Tour on November 29th. Similar to dreamforce salesforce is setting up a small Trailhead Zone and would to involve our community members contributing to its success. We are looking for volunteers to help out at the "Welcome Desk", "Trailhead Library", "Trailhead Quickstarts" & "Demo Stations". Interested members please RSVP before 25th November with your interest.
events.location: Marina Bay Sands Expo & Convention Centre, Orchid & Peony Ballrooms, Level 4, Singapore

events.name: GTS Episode 1: Reactive Programming in the wild
events.description:
You've probably heard of Reactive Programming. It’s a fashionable, new paradigm for modelling asynchronous events in a composable, declarative way. Our mobile developers decided to be trendy, and adopted the world of Observables (aka Signals, Streams) in production. It definitely helped them wade through complex async flows. As code became declarative, it became easier to reason about expected behaviour. Bugs began to flee. Our developers began finding spare time to gym and watch Game of Thrones. Life was good. Or was it? As with any technology in production, they discovered a host of interesting issues that the tutorials and toy projects never mentioned... This talk will cover the fundamentals of Reactive Programming on iOS and Android. It will also include a much needed debate on issues with the paradigm in production. 


Speakers Omer Iqbal iOS Dev who drinks functional programming coolaid for breakfast. Unnaturally obsessed with compilers.  Yang Bo Android dev (since before froyo), who embraces open-source and reusability. Big fan of clean code and architecture design. Also an innovative UI/UX enthusiast  


Schedule 6:30 PM Registration, mingling and snacks 7:00 PM The Talk 8:00 PM PIZZA, and more mingling
events.location: Garena Office,  1 Fusionopolis Place, # 17-10, Galaxis Building, 138522, Singapore

events.name: November Ruby Meetup
events.description:
Hi folks!  Join us for our next meetup, on the 29th of November 7pm at General Assembly. Let us know if your company would like to sponsor or if you'd like to give a 10-15min talk or share 5 Ruby Tips.(contact details at the bottom of the page)  -------------- Programme 1. "Constant Lookups in Ruby & Rails" by Wei-Liang from @tinkerbox 2. "Self-guidance through missteps - beginner's perspective on rails" -  Mikella Seth 3. "Read more" - Grzegorz from @KaligoHotels  4. Announcements & Hot Picks- This is a 5 to 10-minute session, during which anyone can stand up and share something interesting! -------------- Interested to give a talk at future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, your opinions on best practices, or projects you discovered or are working on. And we are especially friendly towards beginners! See you all soon! -------------- Thank you Sponsors! Food & Venue Sponsor  


Video Recording Many thanks to @engineersftw for recording videos of our past meetups which can be found at https://engineers.sg/organizations/57 


 -------------- Books Sponsor http://www.oreilly.com/pub/cpc/35734   

 


Strata + Hadoop World in Singapore, happening December 5-8, is where cutting-edge data science and new business fundamentals merge. It’s a deep-immersion experience where data scientists, analysts, and business executives dissect case studies, develop new skills, share emerging best practices, and build the future of big data. Check out the impressive agenda and speaker lineup. http://www.oreilly.com/pub/cpc/34870 Save 20% with discount code UGSGRUBY. -------------- Job Postings --- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. --------------  Organisers Winston  (@winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com)Mingding  (@hanmd82  / hanmd82@gmail.com)Guo Xiang (@tgx_world  / tgx_world@hotmail.com)
events.location: General Assembly @ Spacemob, 8 Claymore Hill, Singapore 229572

events.name: IBM Champions - Call for Nominations
events.description: IBM values our community of clients and business partners. Each year, we support and build our community by working closely with IBM advocates and helping them to become  IBM Champions IBM Champions are a select group of external advocates made up of clients, business partners and independent consultants who make exceptional contributions to the technical community by speaking at conferences, running or actively participating in user groups, evangelizing relevant technical topics via social media, and helping our clients make the most of IBM technology.  We are looking for clients and business partners to join the program and are looking for applications in the areas of data science, data engineering, application development, and business analytics. Nominations are due by Monday, November 28, 2016 The Champion program is open to candidates worldwide, and candidates may self-nominate or be nominated by someone else. IBM employees are not eligible for the program.  Some benefits of the IBM Champion program: - IBM Champions advocate IBM offerings in the community with competence and credibility (content, blogs, presentations, customer references, analyst/press, videos/podcasts, etc.)- IBM Champions share knowledge with and provide support to the IBM user community (books, articles, blogs, forums, presentations, education, beta programs and customer advisory councils etc.)- IBM Champions support IBM as brand ambassadors who build awareness, share product knowledge, and provide product feedback as users and beta testers Read this  blog post  for full IBM Champion program criteria, guidelines and the <a>nomination form</a>. To learn more about the IBM Champion program from current Champions and Worldwide IBM Champion coordinator Libby Ingrassia, listen to this webcast. Be sure to share the blog and webcast with clients and colleagues who would make great IBM Champions.

events.name: Building A Business People Love: The Beauty Edition
events.description:
RSVP for free here: ga.co/2dO5cFX

Speakers:
Caryn Tan-Lim (Co-founder of Coat & Singapore Beauty Week)
Bernadine Reddy (Founder, Happy Bold Italic; Co-founder, Singapore Beauty Week)
Douglas Gan (Co-Founder & CEO, Vanitee)

Moderator: 
ShuQi Liu, Founder and Editor-In-Chief, Doyenne

A panel of movers and shakers in the complex and impressive world of Singapore’s beauty business will share how they have grown their businesses around their passion for beauty over the years. Get ready to hear about their career struggles, growing pains, trends, and insight on the unique landscape - including what it really takes to grow and run a successful beauty business in Singapore.

We'll discuss:
- Their visions for the future of this exciting community
- How beauty business owners are disrupting the industry with their products, services and strategies
- The challenges and opportunities of being a beauty business owner in Singapore + more….

Stick around afterwards and chat with fellow entrepreneurs, professionals, creatives and innovators!
